title: Traders Place Big Bets on More BOE Rate Cuts Than Market Expects
summary: Options traders have placed one of the biggest bets in over a year on the Bank of England lowering interest rates by more than markets expect, just as policymakers prepare what might be the most hawkish monetary policy decision in months.

title: Top Thai Mall Builder Plans $3.6 Billion Five-Year Expansion
summary: Central Pattana Pcl, Thailand’s largest shopping mall developer, plans to invest more than 120 billion baht ($3.6 billion) in the next five years to build new retail plazas, office buildings and other properties amid rising urbanization and booming tourism.

title: The Trump Administration Is on the Clock to Decide Whether Operation Inherent Resolve Should End
summary: Will President Donald Trump override his predecessor’s decision to shut down Operation Inherent Resolve in Iraq by September 2025? While it has yet to clarify its vision of future U.S. military involvement in Iraq, the Trump administration is faced with a choice: continue with the current plan, extend the mission under new terms, or move up the end date of the mission in line with a stated preference of a complete U.S. troop withdrawal. Among these three options, the looming threat of an Islamic State resurgence makes an accelerated drawdown of Operation Inherent Resolve highly inauspicious. The transition of complete operational responsibility to the The post The Trump Administration Is on the Clock to Decide Whether Operation Inherent Resolve Should End appeared first on War on the Rocks.

title: Kalashnikov unveils prototype of new air defense system
summary: The Kalashnikov Concern, famous for its AK assault rifle family, has presented full-scale functional mock-ups of its latest air defense system, the Krona. The system includes a combat module, a dual-band radar complex, and an automated command post workstation. The unveiling follows the international debut of the Krona-E export variant at the IDEX 2025 defense […] The post Kalashnikov unveils prototype of new air defense system first appeared on Defence Blog.

title: Aurora authorities 'declined' to help search for 2 illegal aliens who escaped Colorado detention facility: ICE
summary: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement said two detainees escaped the Denver Contract Detention Facility in Aurora, Colorado on Tuesday and local authorities are refusing to assist.

title: German Industry Lobby Joins Calls for More Flexible Gas Storage
summary: Germany’s industry lobby pushed for more leeway in refilling gas storage facilities, arguing it would help ease the sector’s struggle with high energy bills.

title: What to Expect From Today’s BOE Interest Rate Decision
summary: The Bank of England will announce its interest rate decision at 12 p.m. in London. Markets and economists expect the Monetary Policy Committee to leave the benchmark interest rate on hold at 4.5% and reiterate a cautious approach to further cuts. Bloomberg’s Ven Ram reports.

title: EU Leaders Meet in Brussels to Discuss Defense Spending
summary: European Union leaders will meet in Brussels to affirm their plans to bolster defense spending at a summit. They will also address concerns about being left out of US President Donald Trump’s efforts to negotiate a ceasefire in Ukraine. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.

title: US Stalls $2.6 Billion Climate Finance Package for South Africa
summary: The US is stalling the distribution of $2.6 billion in climate finance to South Africa, stoking concerns the money might be blocked outright, people familiar with the situation said.

title: News24 | Pope Francis stops using oxygen mask, Vatican says
summary: Pope Francis has suspended the use of an oxygen mask, the Vatican said on Wednesday, adding that the 88-year-old's clinical condition was "improving" after more than one month in hospital.

title: News24 | Trump administration reinstating almost 25 000 fired workers after court order
summary: The Trump administration, in court filings, has for the first time acknowledged that it fired nearly 25 000 recently hired workers and said federal agencies were working to bring all of them back after a judge ruled their terminations were likely illegal.

title: Turkey Turmoil Pushes Lira Borrowing Costs to Highest in Years

title: Court documents related to Prince Harry's immigration to be released to public

title: 'The world is no longer buying Netanyahu’s rhetoric': Papers react to Israel's renewed bombardment
summary: PRESS REVIEW – Wednesday, March 20: The papers in the Arabic world react with anger as Israel resumes its bombardment of Gaza although many of the Israeli dailies defend the move. Elsewhere, several candidates vie to be the new President of the International Olympic Committee, with the campaign turning increasingly sour. Finally, the blobfish completes an extraordinary comeback to be named New Zealand's 'fish of the year'.
